case: A 71-year-old Black presents with new-onset dyspnea on exertion and is found to have tachypnea, tachycardia, and a normal oxygen saturation.
differential: Acute Decompensated Heart Failure (especially with preserved ejection fraction)
Acute Coronary Syndrome (presenting as an anginal equivalent)
New-onset Atrial Fibrillation with Rapid Ventricular Response
Hypertensive Urgency causing acute diastolic dysfunction
